repnme.cdata!: Pakistan - Toot Oil and Gas Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Toot Oil and Gas Development Project
            in Pakistan was partially successful. Throughout the
            implementation of the project, relations between the
            association of the Government of Pakistan (GOP) and OGDC
            have been good. The most important contribution of the
            Association took place during project supervision. The Toot
            Oil and Gas Development Project is the most closely
            supervised petroleum project to date. The experience of the
            project can be considered as another example showing the
            difficulty of bringing about institutional improvement in
            the absence of strong commitment on the part of the
            Borrower/Beneficiary. The underlying cause of OGDC's
            institutional weakness is the fact that it remains a
            government agency working closely under the direction and
            supervision of the concerned ministry but charged with the
            responsibilities in a field where operating autonomy and
            both financial and management independence are standard.
            Therefore, pending a change in the institutional character
            of OCDC, the main thrust of the institution building
            measures will need to be in strengthening OGDC's
            management practices and accounting and management
            information functions. Some meaningful progress in these
            directions was achieved during project implementation.
            However, the concerted efforts of the last few years will
            need to be continued to establish OGDC as a capable and
            competent national oil company.

repnme.cdata!: Pakistan - Toot Oil and Gas Development Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would help Pakistan
            increase its domestic oil production through expansion of
            output from the Toot field; assist OGDC in strengthening its
            capabilities in the effective conduct of oil operations; and
            provide the means for evaluating the potential of the
            recently discovered Dhodak field and preparing for its rapid
            exploitation. Major project components include: the drilling
            of eight wells and provision of surface facilities at Toot;
            logistic support (heavy road transport equipment and a cargo
            aircraft) for OGDC; a seismic survey and reserve evaluation
            at Dhodak; provision of instructors and equipment for the
            Oil & Gas Training Institute; and management and
            accounting consultancy services for OGDC. The project
            carries the risks normally associated with an oil
            development project.

docna.cdata!: Pakistan - Toot Oil and Gas Development Project
